body:
I think this is a good idea.

Some thoughts: 

* The purpose of the JSON is for UI generation.  It's for machines to produce/consume. 
* If a human is writing, JSON is worst than JEXL
* The trade-off will be easier, faster and safer JEXL creation for less power
* The trade off is worth it if it can serve the needs of the majority of experiments
* We should say "use jexl"  when users ask for enhancements that makes the UI more complicated
* A more powerful UI means more code/complexity. We don't want that.
* We want to be able to write JEXL for advanced cases 
* We might be able to use this in the Remote Settings v2 project too!
